sub_title: Performance Manager EU Operations at Danone | Forbes 30 under 30 Asia
summary:
An experienced engineer with a demonstrated history of working in multi-disciplinary roles including sales, technical, and operations. A Forbes 30 under 30 entrepreneur with a recognized passion for making supply chains more sustainable. Currently, working in the FMCG sector, measuring, monitoring, and course-correcting KPIs from design to delivery in the full European scope across categories. 

Enjoys travelling, watching football and web series, and listening to music in his spare time. Interactions across cultures, generations, and disciplines energize him.

treasury_media.title: Indian student creates a brick made from recycled plastic | CNN
treasury_media.description: After an Indian student visited a traditional brick kiln, he was inspired to create the Plastiqube -- an alternative brick made from recycled plastics.

treasury_media.title: Young engineer invents brick made from waste plastic - Global Construction Review
treasury_media.description: A young Indian entrepreneur and engineering student has been shortlisted for a global environmental award for his and colleagues’ efforts to commercialise a new kind of brick made from waste…

treasury_media.title: One brick at a time: building a better future
treasury_media.description: A 22-year-old innovator is setting out to tackle twin challenges in India: plastic waste and air pollution from the brick-clay industry.

treasury_media.title: Qube
treasury_media.description: Indian social enterprise Qube was cofounded by Abhishek Banerjee, Agnimitra Sengupta, Ankan Podder and Utsav Bhattacharyya, who are seeking to make sustainable construction bricks out of plastic waste.

treasury_media.title: Plastic brick slashes carbon and plastic waste
treasury_media.description: Bengal student’s PlastiQube, made of waste plastic, creates 70% less CO2 emissions in manufacture than traditional brick production – and it’s safer for workers too

treasury_media.description: Burnt-clay bricks are among the most popular building materials in India, and the country is their second-largest producer in the world, delivering 200 billion bricks every year. While the brick industry’s rise has increased employment opportunities –...

The University of Texas at Austin

education.field_of_study: Innovation Readiness Series & Entrepreneurship at IC² Institute

awards.title: Forbes 30 under 30 Asia Class of 2019 Honoree
awards.description:
Selected for the Forbes 30 under 30 Asia List - Class of 2019 among thousands of nominations, and then convened by judges from Kai-fu Lee to Hiroshi Mikitani, CZ Zhao and Falguni Nayar. 

In its fourth year now, the Asian list is a continuation of the global expansion of the Forbes 30 Under 30 franchise. It’s a franchise that has had amazing alumni such as Palmer Luckey from Oculus, Evan Spiegel and Bobby Murphy from Snapchat, Ritesh Agarwal from Oyo, Melanie Perkins from Canva and K-pop band BTS to name just a few.

awards.title: Earth Day Network Rising Star
awards.description: Earth Day Network is an international, environmental NGO that began with the first Earth Day on April 22, 1970, and today, 49 years later, it has a global outreach as it engages with around 75,000 organizations in over 190 countries to work on environmental concerns. In recognition of my work in developing plastic bricks called plastiqube, I was nominated as the Earth Day Network Rising Star.

awards.title: Featured on Entrepreneur's Album on Bridge for Billions
Regional Finalist (Asia-Pacific)
awards.description:
I was selected as a Regional Finalist in the Asia Pacific region for the Young Champions of the Earth, in recognition of my team's proposal to create construction materials out of plastic waste.

The United Nations Environment Programme is partnering with Covestro, The Do School and CoalitionWILD to organize the Young Champions of the Earth a forward-looking prize for talented young environmentalists.

https://www.unenvironment.org/youngchampions/bio/2018/asia-and-pacific/abhishek-banerjee
https://www.cleanseas.org/impact/one-brick-time-building-better-future

awards.title: Change Lead
awards.description:
I was accepted for CGI U, batch of 2018. Invited to the Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U) initiative as a Change Maker, to take place from October 19-21, 2018 at the University of Chicago.

CGI U is an annual gathering of college students and youth leaders who come together to address some of the world’s most pressing challenges. Each attendee makes a Commitment to Action, a concrete plan to make a tangible difference within the five following focus areas: education, environment, and climate change, peace and human rights, poverty alleviation, and public health.

awards.title: Smart 50
awards.description: Selected among top 400 startups out of 15,000 applicants across India in Smart 50 organised by the Department of Science & Technology of India and Indian Institute of Management Calcutta Innovation Park.
awards.issuer: Department of Science & Technology of India and Indian Institute of Management Calcutta Innovation Park

awards.title: Young Social Entrepreneur (YSE 2018)
awards.description: I was selected among the top 47 teams globally to attend the Young Social Entrepreneur Workshop by Singapore International Foundation.

awards.title: Youth for Business Competition (Y4Biz)
awards.description: Selected among 57 startup ideas in Youth for Business Competition (Y4Biz), an initiative by US Consulate Kolkata with learning opportunity at IC² Institute, The University of Texas at Austin.
awards.issuer: US Consulate Kolkata & IC² Institute, The University of Texas at Austin

awards.title: Youth Leader
awards.description: I was selected out of 1400 applicants to participate at the Asia Student Summit organised in Seoul.

awards.title: Yunus&Youth Global Fellowship
awards.description:
Was selected as a Yunus&Youth Fellow for Class 4 of the Y&Y Fellowship Program, out of 220 applications from 55 countries.

Yunus&Youth's main objective is to create social change. Y&Y aims to create waves of fellows running sustainable social businesses; inspired mentors channeling their experience into impact; and empowered partners learning about young innovation.

https://yunusandyouth.com/project/abhishek-banerjee/

https://yunusandyouth.com/abhishek-banerjee/

profile_positions.description:
•	Executed sales and collection KPIs for passive fire protection products in East India, along with delivering technical consultancy and subsequently collaborating with the supply chain team to ensure efficient operational activities.
•	Projected demand forecast to replenish the stock at the regional warehouse and ensured that there is a continuous improvement of the level of inventory and the distribution involved is efficient. 
•	Managed accounts of high-profile and strategic customers with portfolios worth revenues of 2.3 million Euros and delivered 18.7% growth to a non-performing area while being promoted as the youngest consultant in the company.
profile_positions.title: Fire Protection Consultant - East India

profile_positions.description: Was responsible for sales and collection of high profile accounts in Kolkata area with market reach team.
profile_positions.title: Technical Account Manager

profile_positions.description: Worked on special projects wherein developed a platform where all the information about a particular job site was accessible to everyone and where account manager share or pass on relevant information or leads to a fellow teammate, leading to more transparency and better efficiency in the system.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Engineer Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Qube was a social enterprise whose mission is to change the world, one brick at a time. The company was involved in  developing construction bricks made out of plastic waste called plastiqube, thus addressing the issue of plastic waste disposal and also empowering the workers subjected to abysmal working conditions in the traditional burnt-clay brick sector in India.

•	Conceptualized “plastiqube” bricks, made completely of plastic waste as a greener alternative to traditional burnt clay bricks and was successful in creating the material prototype.
•	Formulated the reporting standards to ascertain the economic, social, and environmental benefits of using “plastiqube".
•	Featured in the Forbes 30 under 30 list (Asia) under the Social Entrepreneur category.
•	Awarded accolades and recognition from CNN, UN Environment, Earth Day Network, Clinton Global Initiative, Yunus & Youth among others.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Identified and mapped new construction projects in Kolkata Region, thereby increasing the business scope and revenue opportunity in 196 new projects in a span of one month.

Received a Pre-Placement Offer (PPO) for exemplary contributions during the internship.
profile_positions.title: Sales Intern

profile_positions.description: Worked on a project that involved sourcing and establishing base material manufacturers in India that could produce the same quality as the imported ones, the successful implementation of which could save more than 2 MINR annually and potentially a global saving for the Hilti group of more than 200 MINR. Also identified and recommended incorporation of higher grades of base materials into Hilti Manufacturing India's library, keeping up with the emerging trends in construction industry.
profile_positions.title: Test Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description: The training involved the study of contracts/tenders, surveying, quality control and civil execution work in piling and pier construction, concreting of I-girders, setting out pile points, preparation of rig movement plan, boring activity, prestressing procedure, boom placer, bridge deck slab, diaphragm wall and gantry girders.
profile_positions.title: Summer Trainee

profile_positions.description: The project involved site visits to calculate the amount of brick work done, drawing bar bending schedules for small structures in and around the site, site visits for to observe curing, scaffolding, shuttering, centering, concreting and compacting, site knowledge of quality control tests, surveying with the chief surveyor (excavation work) and demonstration of testing procedure for pile integrity test.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: I had delivered a speech on the importance of passive fire protection.

(http://www.juecell.in/)

We are a group of zealous individuals who are passionate to create a conducive atmosphere for budding entrepreneurs in our campus wherein they get to interact with investors, mentors, industry experts, start-up founders and also provide them abundant opportunities to improve their ideas by participating in business plan competitions and hackathons. 

As the creative head, my responsibilities include inventing new ideas for branding, advertising campaigns and marketing messages, understanding the design and smart copy, recognizing fresh approaches to advertising  and leading brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas.
Was a member of the organising committee for Startup Weekend Kolkata 4.0, in association with Jadavpur University E-Cell.

HBR Ascend Select is an exclusive and an invite-only community of aspiring leaders, handpicked by HBR Ascend. As a member, I get the opportunity to share my views and opinions with the editorial, marketing and product teams of HBR Ascend. I also participate in various research projects led by HBR Ascend.

Had the responsibility of creating attractive and engaging posters, for both online and offline marketing purpose to ensure maximum participation in the event. Was also part of the team that organized the on day event.
I was awarded Best Speaker & Most Improved Speaker ribbons.
